During Week 2 of the Deep Learning module, we were given this assignment: Objective: Challenge accepted. I used Google Colab for this‚Ä¶

entry.title: Postmarks - emailable, searchable link bookmarking
entry.summary:
This is a submission for the Postmark Challenge: Inbox Innovators. Postmarks (naming things eh...) is a personal link bookmarking service. Users interact with the service via email, obviously, and can email a link to be bookmarked, email to list their links, and email a query to search for links via content. Each user get's their own database, courtesy of Cloudflare Durable Objects. It's barebones, but it was a fun little project. Screenshots are below - it's email, so not much to demo. I've redacted the inbound email address to protect my Postmark free account email limit, but if the judges reach out I'll share the email address to interact with the app. Email a link:
Link added reply:
Search for a link:
Search result reply:
https://github.com/leesus/postmarks The app makes use of Postmarks Inbound and Transactional streams, to interact with a Cloudflare Worker, backed by Vectorize and Durable Objects. The smarts are provided by Workers AI, via the Vercel AI SDK. A full step-by-step tutorial is available on the GitHub repo.

entry.title: Xiaomi Joins the Custom SoC Race
entry.summary: Xiaomi has officially entered the custom SoC arena, joining tech giants like Samsung (Exynos), Google (Tensor), and Huawei (Kirin). Their in-house chipset aims to reduce dependency on third-party vendors like Qualcomm while delivering tighter integration with MIUI or HyperOS. This move allows Xiaomi to optimize AI, camera processing, and energy efficiency natively. By developing its own silicon, Xiaomi gains complete hardware-software control across its devices. Like Google‚Äôs Tensor designed for Pixel, Xiaomi‚Äôs chip will fuel smarter experiences. The shift marks a significant step toward a fully owned and unified tech platform. It‚Äôs more than performance‚Äîit's ecosystem empowerment. Xiaomi has unveiled a fully autonomous smart factory capable of round-the-clock operation without human worke‚Ä¶

entry.title: Are Dating Apps Just Digital Honeytraps?
entry.summary: In the era of digital romance, dating apps have become a popular way for people to connect, find love, and build relationships. However, beneath the surface of swipes and matches lies a complex landscape of data mining, privacy concerns, and potential risks. Let's explore the dual nature of dating apps, examining whether they foster real love or serve as digital honeytraps for data mining and blackmail. Dating apps have revolutionized the way people meet and interact, offering convenience, accessibility, and a vast pool of potential partners. Platforms like Tinder, Bumble, Hinge, and OkCupid have gained immense popularity, with millions of users worldwide seeking love, companionship, and meaningful connections. Dating apps promise to simplify the process of finding love, using algorithms a‚Ä¶

entry.title: Deploying a Multi-Tier Web App on AWS: A Journey Through Challenges and Costly Lesson
entry.summary: As part of my journey to master cloud computing and DevOps, I recently completed an intermediate-level project: deploying a multi-tier web application on AWS. The goal was to build a secure, scalable architecture with a web server in a public subnet and a database server in a private subnet, using AWS services like EC2, VPC, and security groups. While the project was a success, it came with significant hurdles‚Äîboth technical and financial. In this blog post, I‚Äôll walk you through the project‚Äôs objectives, the numerous issues I faced, how I resolved them, and a costly lesson about AWS resource cleanup that left me with a $27 bill. The project had clear goals to test my AWS and Linux skills: Launch EC2 Instances: Set up one web server and one database server using Amazon EC2. Configure Nginx‚Ä¶

entry.title: Why I Chose Biotechnology and Why I‚Äôm Learning Bioinformatics with R
entry.summary:
Hi! I'm Oƒüuzhan, a 3rd-year biotechnology student based in Turkey. I've always been fascinated by how the brain works, how genes influence our behavior, and how we can use data and artificial intelligence to understand‚Äîand maybe even enhance‚Äîhuman cognition. Recently, I started learning bioinformatics, especially using R and Galaxy to analyze gene expression and biological datasets. It‚Äôs a challenging but exciting journey. I plan to learn Biopython next, but for now, I‚Äôm focusing on building a solid foundation in R. In this blog, I‚Äôll share: What I learn in bioinformatics and biotechnology Tutorials and beginner-friendly projects in R Reflections from my classes and personal studies Ideas about neuroscience, AI, and the future of biotech If you're a student, a beginner in bioinformatics, or just curious about where biology meets technology, I‚Äôd love to connect. Have you also started learning bioinformatics? What helped you the most? I'd love to hear your experience in the comments! Let‚Äôs learn and grow together üöÄ
Stay tuned for my first technical post: A beginner‚Äôs guide to gene expression analysis in R. ‚Äî Oƒüuzhan

entry.title: Hyperliquid trader James Wynn goes ‚Äòall-in‚Äô on $1.25B Bitcoin Long
entry.summary: Well-known Hyperliquid trader James Wynn has increased his 40x leverage long Bitcoin bet to $1.25 billion after closing his $PEPE position for a $25.2 million profit. On May 24, Lookonchain reported that Wynn entered an 11,588 BTC position with an average entry price of $108,243 and a liquidation level of $105,180. The move came hours after Wynn exited his Ether (ETH) and Sui (SUI) longs at a $5.3 million loss. At the time, he used the proceedings to double down on Bitcoin (BTC), increasing his position to 11,070 BTC. Wynn began his Bitcoin long position with $830 million on May 21, trimming $400 million in profits the same day. By May 22, he ramped the position back up to $1.1 billion, holding high leverage as BTC crossed $110,000 and gained $39 million on paper. He later sold 540 BTC for‚Ä¶

entry.title: Your Deleted Data Can Come Back to Haunt You!
entry.summary: In the digital age, the question of whether a file can be truly deleted is more relevant than ever. With the evolution of storage technologies, particularly the shift from traditional hard disk drives (HDDs) to solid-state drives (SSDs), the methods and effectiveness of file deletion have changed significantly. Let's explore the intricacies of file deletion, the differences between SSD forensics and old-school disk wiping, and debunk some common myths. When you delete a file from your computer, it's not immediately erased from the storage device. Instead, the operating system removes the file's entry from the file system, marking the space it occupied as available for new data. This means that the file's data remains on the storage device until it is overwritten by new files. In traditiona‚Ä¶

entry.title: How We Fixed Our Shipping Integration Chaos with Ditto: A Fulfillment Use Case in E-Commerce
entry.summary:
How We Fixed Our Shipping Integration Chaos with Ditto: A Fulfillment Use Case in E-Commerce
The modern e-commerce supply chain moves fast‚Äîbut integrating with third-party shipping services doesn‚Äôt. We learned this the hard way, juggling broken APIs, unreliable sandbox environments, and zero visibility into request/response flows. üì¶ The Problem: Shipping APIs Were Slowing Us Down
We‚Äôre an e-commerce platform managing thousands of orders per day. Shipping is critical to our customer experience. But integrating with new carriers or updating old integrations was painful: No reliable sandboxes: Most shipping providers had inconsistent or outdated test environments. Delayed feedback: Every change needed a full deploy, then a real API hit, and then debugging based on logs. Hard to test edge cases: Simulating scenarios like "address not found", "label unavailable", or "customs hold" was impossible. Cross-team bottlenecks: Backend, QA, and devOps were constantly waiting on each other just to test a single flow. Every integration took weeks longer than it should have, with late nights spent tailing logs and replaying requests. üöÄ Enter Ditto: Mock APIs That Work Like the Real Thing
We deployed Ditto internally as a drop-in mock server platform. Think of it like Postman‚Äîbut private, flexible, and built for teams. 1. Created realistic mocks for all shipping APIs 2. Collaborative interface 3. Integrated with CI/CD 4. Zero downtime testing üè≠ Use Case: Fulfillment ‚Üí Shipping in E-Commerce
Here‚Äôs a specific example: Scenario: Pain Point: With Ditto: üí∞ ROI: Faster Delivery Times, Happier Devs, and Lower Costs
After adopting Ditto, our team saw immediate benefits:
We estimate that Ditto saved over 200 hours of dev time in the first quarter alone. More importantly, it helped us ship (pun intended) with confidence. APIs should never be a bottleneck. With Ditto, they‚Äôre not. Want to see Ditto in action? Check it out here or spin up your own mock environment in minutes.

entry.title: Trump‚Äôs use of presidential seal at memecoin event raises legal questions
entry.summary: President Donald Trump is facing scrutiny after speaking at a private event for top investors in his $TRUMP memecoin while standing behind a lectern emblazoned with the official presidential seal ‚Äî a move that may violate federal law. The event took place Thursday at Trump National Golf Club in Virginia, where Trump addressed 220 investors in his cryptocurrency project. According to US law, the presidential seal cannot be used in any manner that could imply government approval or sponsorship. Violators can face fines or up to six months in prison. Trump, who arrived at the club aboard a military helicopter, praised attendees and took aim at the Biden administration‚Äôs crypto stance. When asked about potential conflicts of interest, White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said the presi‚Ä¶

entry.title: Judge overturns fraud convictions in Mango Markets exploit case
entry.summary: A US federal judge has vacated key fraud and manipulation convictions against Avraham Eisenberg, the trader at the center of the case involving a $110 million exploit of the decentralized exchange Mango Markets. On Friday, US District Judge Arun Subramanian ruled that the evidence presented at trial failed to support the jury‚Äôs conclusion that Eisenberg made materially false representations to Mango Markets. The decision vacates Eisenberg‚Äôs convictions for commodities fraud and market manipulation and acquits him of a third charge, significantly weakening the government‚Äôs case. Eisenberg, a self-proclaimed ‚Äúapplied game theorist,‚Äù was convicted in 2024 for artificially inflating the price of Mango‚Äôs MNGO token by over 1,300% in a matter of minutes and using the resulting gains as collatera‚Ä¶

The $2.75 billion in inflows is approximately 4.5 times larger than the previous week‚Äôs $608 million, according to Farside data. BlackRock Bitcoin ETF continues inflow streak On May 23, the final day of the trading week, spot Bitcoin (BTC) ETFs recorded $211.7 million in inflows. However, BlackRock‚Äôs IBIT was the only fund to post gains in the trading day, adding $430.8 million and extending its inflow streak to eight consecutive days. Grayscale‚Äôs GBTC led outflows with $89.2 million, followed by ARK 21Shares‚Äô ARKB with $73.9 million. Just two days before, on May 21, the Bitcoin ETFs saw $607.1 million in inflows, the‚Ä¶

entry.title: Onchain privacy is a necessity in the age of AI ‚Äî Shielded CEO
entry.summary: Blockchain privacy tools such as zero-knowledge (ZK) proofs will become increasingly necessary to protect online user data in the age of artificial intelligence, according to Eran Barak, CEO of Shielded Technologies, the developer behind the Midnight privacy chain. In an interview with Cointelegraph at Consensus 2025, Barak said corporate service providers and centralized servers are expected to become honeypots for AI-assisted hackers and malicious actors looking to steal valuable data, including private keys, financial metadata, medical records, and government documents. Hackers targeting centralized entities have a "massive" return on investment (ROI) and are incentivized to hack centralized targets that contain millions of valuable records, the CEO told Cointelegraph. Barak added that ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Semler Scientific boosts BTC holdings with $50M purchase
entry.summary: Semler Scientific, a medical device company, purchased of $50 million worth of Bitcoin between May 13 and May 22, bringing the market value of the company‚Äôs Bitcoin (BTC) holdings to $474.4 million, keeping it within the top 13 of BTC Treasury companies. According to a May 23 disclosure, Semler bought a total of 455 BTC for an average purchase price of $109,801. To buy the Bitcoin, Semler Scientific used proceeds from an at-the-market stock offering program. So far, the company has sold roughly 3 million shares of common stock for net proceeds of $115 million. Semler Scientific‚Äôs shares have fallen 1.36% on the same day as the disclosure, though the decrease in its share price is largely in line with the Nasdaq‚Äôs performance. That index, which follows top tech stocks, is down 1% on the day. Semler Scientific share price. Source: Google Finance In its Q1 2025 earnings report released on May 13, the company revealed a 44% drop in revenue year-over-year. Despite the claimed success of its Bitcoin treasury plan, Semler Scientific‚Äôs shares have dropped 18% in 2025, according to Google Finance. Bitcoin treasury companies, or companies that traditionally sell equity or issue debt to buy BTC, had been drawing the interest of investors looking for exposure to Bitcoin price fluctuations. Michael Saylor's Strategy debuted its BTC reserve in August 2020, when it started purchasing Bitcoin. Bitcoin is up 181.6% year to date, while Semler Scientific shares rose 53% since announcing the BTC approach in May 2024. Magazine: ZK-proofs are bringing smart contracts to Bitcoin ‚Äî BitcoinOS and Starknet

entry.summary:
Texas Governor Greg Abbott has signaled support for a bill recently passed by the state House of Representatives that would establish a strategic cryptocurrency reserve. In a May 22 X post, Abbott posted a Techstory article about Texas state lawmakers‚Äô efforts to create a Bitcoin (BTC) reserve. The story pointed out that the decision for the passage of SB 21, the bill in question, now rests on Abbott‚Äôs shoulders, roughly three months after it was introduced.¬† Since taking office, Abbott referred to himself as a ‚Äúcrypto law proposal supporter‚Äù in 2021 and suggested that he would support policies to establish Texas as a ‚Äúcrypto capital‚Äù in 2024. Texas was one of a handful of state-level governments that proposed setting up a strategic crypto reserve after the 2024 federal elections.¬†¬†¬†

entry.title: Crypto Biz: From shorting the Venezuelan Bolivar to shorting the US dollar
entry.summary: When Venezuela was experiencing hyperinflation, Ledn co-founder Mauricio di Bartolomeo hedged against the collapsing local currency by shorting it in favor of the more stable US dollar. Today, he‚Äôs using a similar strategy ‚Äî this time borrowing against his Bitcoin (BTC) to hedge against the crumbling US dollar. Di Bartolomeo connected with me during Canada Crypto Week in Toronto, where he talked about the advantages of Bitcoin-backed loans and the rapid growth of collateralized BTC lending. In our interview, he made a compelling case for continuing to stack sats, even as Bitcoin‚Äôs price keeps rising. This week‚Äôs Crypto Biz dives into our conversation with the Ledn co-founder and covers the latest business news from the blockchain world. A lesson from hyperinflation Before Bitcoin, di Barto‚Ä¶

entry.title: US House members call for investigation into Trump's memecoin dinner

Bloomberg reported that a majority of the attendees at the memecoin dinner were likely forei‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin‚Äôs bull market will ‚Äòredefine‚Äô BTC‚Äôs role in modern portfolios ‚Äî Fidelity research
entry.summary:
Key takeaways:
Bitcoin‚Äôs performance in the current bull market and a new cohort of buyers reflect a maturing market and widening adoption.
A 50% rise in hashrate and a 63% jump in Realized Cap highlight investors‚Äô confidence in Bitcoin.
A recent report from Fidelity Digital Assets explored how the current Bitcoin market cycle reflects a shift toward a maturing market where the rate of adoption deepens and expands. At block height 892,500‚Äîmarking 25% progress into the current halving epoch‚ÄîBitcoin traded between $82,500 and $85,000, representing a 31% increase from its value on April 19, 2024, when the fourth halving reduced block rewards to 3.125 BTC. Bitcoin: halving cycles compared. Source: Fidelity Digital Assets Fidelity‚Äôs senior research analyst Daniel Gray emphasized Bitcoin‚Äôs ne‚Ä¶

HeyMint‚Äôs co-founder and chief technology officer, Flor Ronsmans De Vry, joins Alchemy as part of the deal.¬† While not a household name in crypto, HeyMint attracted more than 1 million users over its first two years of operations. entry.title: Spoiler alert: The future of Web3 is not blockchain
entry.summary: Opinion by: Grigore Ro»ôu, founder and chief executive officer of Pi Squared For some, the audacity of questioning the primacy of blockchain in Web3 is borderline heretical. The idea that decentralization and progress could exist without blockchains seems absurd to those who built careers around Bitcoin, Ethereum, and their descendants. Given blockchain's well-documented scaling limits, however, there is an argument to be made that Web3 doesn't actually need blockchains to thrive. Instead, it requires payment systems and verifiable settlement systems that are super fast. Blockchains are just one way to achieve that, not the only way. While blockchain solved the double-spending problem, it introduced its own architectural burden: the rigid fixation on total ordering, dictating that every tra‚Ä¶

Attendees spent a grand total of $148 million for an ‚Äúultra-exclusive VIP reception with the president,‚Äù which crypto industry advocates and critics alike saw as a potential opportunity to discuss crypto policy with the president.¬† The crowd contained a number of foreign crypto executives and influencers who otherwise would not have access to the US president, raising questions around corruption and foreign influence.¬† Concerns were further augmented when White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt declined to release a list of attendees, stating that the event was a private affair outside of Trump‚Äôs presidential duties.‚Ä¶

entry.title: What is DNS hijacking? How it took down Curve Finance‚Äôs website
entry.summary:
Understanding the Curve Finance DNS hijacking
On May 12, 2025, at 20:55 UTC, hackers hijacked the ‚Äú.fi‚Äù domain name system (DNS) of Curve Finance after managing to access the registrar. They began sending its users to a malicious website, attempting to drain their wallets. This was the second attack on Curve Finance‚Äôs infrastructure in a week. Users were directed to a website that was a non-functional decoy, designed only to trick users into providing wallet signatures. The hack hadn‚Äôt breached the protocol‚Äôs smart contracts and was limited to the DNS layer. The DNS is a critical component of the internet that functions like a phonebook. It allows you to use simple, memorable domain names (such as facebook.com) instead of complex numerical IP addre‚Ä¶

entry.title: Twice lucky? Cetus‚Äô recovery plan on Sui mirrors a Solana blueprint
entry.summary: The bounty offer to recover stolen funds from Sui-based decentralized exchange (DEX) Cetus closely resembles a successful strategy used by a Solana project three years ago. It turns out that Cetus shares the same development team as Crema Finance, a Solana-based DeFi project that suffered a $9-million hack in 2022 but recovered most of the funds by negotiating with its hacker. Now, Cetus is relying on the same strategy. Cetus is asking the hacker to return all but $6 million, or 2,324 Ether (ETH), of the stolen funds in exchange for a promise not to pursue legal action. The protocol lost $223 million to an exploit on May 22. The size of the bounty has sparked backlash from users, with many calling for a formal compensation plan instead. Several community members argue that even if funds ar‚Ä¶

entry.title: Washington moves on crypto: Stablecoin and blockchain bills signal regulatory momentum
entry.summary:
In this week‚Äôs episode of Byte-Sized Insight, on Decentralize with Cointelegraph, we break down a pivotal moment for US crypto legislation.¬† In a 66‚Äì32 procedural vote on May 19, the US Senate advanced the GENIUS Act, a landmark bill aimed at establishing a comprehensive regulatory framework for stablecoins. Meanwhile, across the Capitol, Representative Tom Emmer reintroduced the Blockchain Regulatory Certainty Act, backed by bipartisan support.
Breaking down GENIUS The GENIUS Act ‚Äî short for ‚ÄúGuiding and Establishing National Innovation for U.S. Stablecoins Act‚Äù ‚Äî seeks to answer foundational questions around stablecoin issuance and oversight. ‚ÄúIt defines this idea of a payment stablecoin,‚Äù explained Rashan Colbert, director of US policy at the Crypto Council for Innovation, in this week‚Ä¶

entry.title: Can ChatGPT-powered AI agents really trade crypto for you?
entry.summary:
Key takeaways
ChatGPT-powered AI agents automate trading tasks using natural language prompts and API integrations, improving speed and consistency.
Successes occur when ChatGPT is used as a support tool, not a fully autonomous trading system.
Failures happen when traders over-rely on ChatGPT without real-time data, proper risk management or manual oversight.
Regulatory focus on AI in trading is increasing, with new frameworks emerging to ensure transparency, accountability and compliance.
What if a crypto trader didn‚Äôt need to constantly check charts, worry about emotions, or stay up all night watching for sudden price swings? What if those tasks could be handled by an intelligent agent that understands instructions in plain English ‚Äî and reacts within milliseconds? That‚Äôs where Chat‚Ä¶
